frame.name: Ontogeny
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> develops from a <fen>Prior_state</fen> to a <fen>Post_state</fen>. The <fen>Entity</fen> can also be represented by an entity-denoting adjective which is labeled <fen>Domain</fen> as shown in the first example below. NOTE: This frame is not intended for the evolution of an entire species, but rather the development of a single organism. <ex></ex> <ex>Yesterday we learned about <fex name="Domain">neural</fex> <t>development</t>.</ex> <ex></ex> <ex>Sherman studies <fex name="Entity">nervous system</fex> <t>development</t> <fex name="Organism">in toddlers</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex> <ex>The researchers were studying the <t>development</t> <fex name="Entity">of hair cells</fex>. </ex> <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Entity">This small bud</fex> will <t>grow</t> <fex name="Post_state">into a flower</fex> <fex name="Time">someday soon</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The part of the <fen>Organism</fen> which is undergoing biological development.
<ex>The <t>development</t> <fex name="Ent">of a human embryo</fex> is fascinating to study.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Organism
FE.definition:
<def-root>The living thing whose <fen>Entity</fen> is undergoing development.
<ex>Rachel studies nervous system <t>development</t> <fex name="Org">in apes</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Prior_state
FE.definition:
<def-root>The stage from which the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
<ex>She <t>grew</t> <fex name="Prior_state">from a child</fex> to a teenager in what seemed like minutes.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Post_state
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state into which the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
<ex>She watched her baby <t>grow</t> <fex name="Post_state">into an adult</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
<ex><fex name="Time">Someday</fex> this bud will <t>grow</t> into a rose.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
<ex>You can see the <fex name="Degree">partial</fex> <t>development</t> of the fingers on the ultrasound.. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The relevant dimension of development. Usually expressed by an entity-denoting adjective.
<ex> <fex name="Domain">Embryonic</fex> <t>development</t> had been stunted by the disease. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> in which the development occurs.
<ex>The cells are <t>developing</t> <fex name="Manner">normally</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
<ex>The cells were <t>developing</t> rapidly <fex name="Place">in the Petri dish</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Rate</fen> at which the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
<ex>The cells were <t>developing</t> <fex name="Rate">rapidly</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period over which the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
<ex>The tissue <t>grew</t> rapidly <fex name="Duration">throughout the evening</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: develop.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to progress from one biological state to another

lexUnit.name: development.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the advancement of an organism from one stage to another

lexUnit.name: grow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to develop from one biological stage to another (not specifically pertaining to the size of an entity, but usually entails it)

lexUnit.name: growth.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the development from one biological stage to another (not specifically pertaining to the size of an entity, but usually entails it)
